text: Hi, did the toggle for "Unstyled form" for disappear in the Form Options? I don´t see it

i have this report from SEMRush, and its talking about the .css and .js files that come from the custom modules themself, is there something we aren’t doing or should we just be putting this in a global css and js file to solve this issue
^ Literally experiencing the same issue, except we have 204 issues instead of 30

Hey community I'm little confused... I discover that the FOLLOWUP EMAIL option is not possible with the CMS standalone.... My client has to take the MARKETING PRO  just to have this little feature that is include in most of standard CMS... So I think it could be a great idea to add this feature in the native configuration of the standalone or in the Marketing Starter a minima. Don't we ?
anyone give you an answer on how to resolve?

I think the only answer right now really would be to do as you suggested and make one long master stylesheet. I think HubSpot was compiling and minifying these files at one point, but for whatever reason they are now reverting to multiple individual assets

nope, but there are a few support articles about it on HubSpot forums. From the looks of it, we're SOL since HubSpot is supposed to be auto-minifying everything. And if it's not, then there might be syntax errors (?)
this has happened with me too
Hello everyone! Is it possible to modify a HubSpot form embed code so I can overwrite the onsubmit page redirect that was set when the form was actually created? Thank you
<@UCBPF45EF> here is a link for all the things you can customize with the form embed code: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/forms/advanced_form_options>
<@U2H3TT8F2> Thank you so much!

Is there a way to map a field on a collected form to a specific propery without just changing the label or name? Is there some other attribute I could add to the input? I have a "Zip code" field that isn't mapping to the zip property.
It looks like there's something about a "data-leadin-" attribute in the source, but I'm not really sure if that's anything
